subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] My Progress
msgSnippet: There isn’t much, really. All of us who’ve made Quikscript fonts have tried — and failed — to properly recreate the joins of Senior Quikscript. Outside
messageBody:
There isn’t much, really. All of us who’ve made Quikscript fonts have tried — and failed — to properly recreate the joins of Senior Quikscript. Outside of the samples in the manual, I’d read the letter-writing-circle letter in <https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/Read_Alphabet/files/Hand%20Written%20Text/>. That said, the only way I’m really able to practice Senior is by keeping page 17 of the manual on-screen and in the corner of my eye while I scribble Senior in my journal.

On Oct 30, 2017, at 4:27 AM, tvindy@... [Read_Alphabet] <Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com> wrote:

Thanks for the tips. The Memrise course actually does teach some Quickscript senior. There are many abbreviations and partial letters linked together. The only issue is that since the words are created with a computer font, and not handwritten, they look kind of clunky. Looking over the manual, I can see that there are still some aspects of QS senior that I haven't learned yet. My next step after finishing the course will be to work my way through a text written in QS senior. (If anyone has a link to a good one, please let me know.). That should get me most of the way there.
